item.title: Report X-2023100237
item.description:
Report X-2023100237

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-25
  • City: SANTA TERESA
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered wet/leaking by admin in unload area. Who then followed proper procedure and investigation. DescribePack: After inspection, the cause of the leak/spillage were loose caps on three of the 4 liters containers. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Package was isolated from other packages and brought to QA for inspection.

item.title: Report X-2023090455
item.description:
Report X-2023090455

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: BELEN
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PROX 12217 was found by a carmen to be leaking from the bottom of the tank during an outbound inspection. After investigation by BNSF Hazmat, it was determined that the leak was coming from the jacket, indicating a tank failure somewhere under the jacket. Approximately 50 gallons were recovered from containment pools. The car was moved to a siding after containment measures were put into place. The car was then transloaded into poly tanks while awaiting empty cars to arrive. The poly tanks were then transferred into two separate tank cars due to the smaller capacities than the original tank car.

item.title: Report X-2023090454
item.description:
Report X-2023090454

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: ENCINO
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SHQX 12053 was found to be leaking from the top of the car during an FRA inspection. Upon investigation by BNSF HazMat, the leak was noted as coming from the manway. The swing bolts were tool tight, however after opening the manway lid, the gasket was noted to be in bad condition along with a pinching of the gasket at the leak origin. The manway gasket was replaced and the swing bolts were tool-tightened.

item.title: Report X-2023081760
item.description:
Report X-2023081760

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-03T00:35:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-19
  • City: GALLUP
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during offload of the vehicle. The package contained 5 glass bottles marked with "Sample" and "Tank 19TGP" "Tank 15TGP" "Tank 6TDP" "Tank 4TDP" "Tank 15TGP". Three of the five bottles were broken. The shipper confirmed that the contents were undeclared fuel samples. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and held for FAA investigation.
